The default crawl configuration in H1 or H3 should be close to what you 
need.

There are 3 main reasons that configuration will collect some URLs on 
hostnames other than those in your seed URI:

(1) to get embedded resources (via IMG, SCRIPT, STYLE, FRAME, etc.) that 
appear necessary to render an already-crawled page
(2) to get the destination URI of a redirect that started in-scope
(3) to get other resources that *might* be necessary for rendering the 
page, but our current link-extraction can't be sure -- the so-called 
'speculative' outlinks, marked 'X' in the hops-path-from-seed string, 
and primarily from Javascript

You can tighten any of these by either changing the settings on the 
'TransclusionDecideRule' to allow fewer 'transHops' (non-A/@HREF of any 
type) or fewer 'specualtiveHops' (any 'X') than the defaults, or you can 
discard the TransclusionDecideRule entirely if you never want to expand 
the scope for rendering completeness' sake.

(If you do discard the rule, make sure you have a 
PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule late in the rules; older versions of H1 
might not have that, and depended on transclusion in some cases for 
necessary prerequisites to be allowed.)

- Gordon @ IA
